Publications

    Journal Articles

  1. Increasing the Activity of Immobilized Enzymes with Nanoparticle Conjugation

    Shaowei Ding, Allison A. Cargill, Igor L. Medintz, Jonathan C. Claussen

    Curr. Opin. Biotechnol., In Review

  2. Probing the Enzymatic Activity of Alkaline Phosphatase within Quantum Dot Bioconjugates

    J.C. Claussen, A. Malanoski, J.C. Breger, E. Oh, S.A. Walper, K. Susumu, R. Goswami, J.R. Deschamps, I.L. Medintz

    The Journal of Physical Chemistry C., 2015

  3. Three-dye dynamic DNA scaffolds for photonic switching and logic through fluorescence resonance energy transfer

    S. Buckout-White, J.C. Claussen, M.G. Ancona, E. White, I.L. Medintz

    RSC Advances, 4, 90, 2014

  4. Platinum-paper micromotors: An urchin-like nanohybrid catalyst for green monopropellant bubble-thrusters

    J.C. Claussen, M. A. Daniele, J. Gedder, M. Pruessner, Antti J. Mäkinen, B. Melde, Mark Twigg, Jasenka Verbarg, and Igor Medintza

    ACS Appl. Mater & Interfaces – 6, 20, 2014

  5. Nanomaterial-mediated biosensors for monitoring glucose

    M. Taguchi, A. Ptitsyn, E.S. McLamore, J.C. Claussen

    Journal of diabetes science and technology 8 (2), 403-411, 2014

  6. Complex Logic Functions Implemented with Quantum-Dot Bionanophotonic Circuits

    J.C. Claussen, N. Hildebrandt, K. Susumu, M.G. Ancona, I.L. Medintz

    ACS Applied Materials & Interfaces 6 (6), 3771–3778, 2013

  7. Biophotonic logic devices based on quantum dots and temporally-staggered Förster energy transfer relays

    J.C. Claussen, W.R. Algar, N. Hildebrandt, K. Susumu, M.G. Ancona, I.L. Medintz

    Nanoscale 5 (24), 12156-12170, 2013

  8. Emerging technologies for non-invasive quantification of physiological oxygen transport in plants

    P. Chaturvedi, M. Taguchi, S.L. Burrs, B.A. Hauser, W. Salim, J.C. Claussen, E. S. McLamore

    Planta 238 (3), 599-614, 2013

  9. Acoustic Droplet Vaporization and Propulsion of Perfluorocarbon‐Filled Microbullets for Targeted Tissue Penetration and Deformation

    J.C. Claussen, D. Kagan, M.J. Benchimol, E. Chuluun‐Erdene, S. Esener, J. Wang

    Angewandte Chemie 124 (30), 7637-7640, 2012

  10. Nanostructuring platinum nanoparticles on graphene petal nanosheets for electrochemical biosensing

    J.C. Claussen, A. Kumar, D.B. Jaroch, M.H. Khawaja, A.B. Hibbard, D.M. Porterfield, T.S. Fisher

    Advanced Functional Materials 22 (16), 3399-3405, 2012

  11. Multiplexed and switchable release of distinct fluids from microneedle platforms via conducting polymer nanoactuators for potential drug delivery

    J.C. Claussen, G. Valdés-Ramírez, J.R. Windmiller, A.G. Martinez, F. Kuralay, M. Zhou, R. Narayan, J. Wang

    Sensors and Actuators B: Chemical 161 (1), 1018-1024, 2012

  12. Bacterial Isolation by Lectin-Modified Microengines

    S. Campuzano, J. Orozco, D. Kagan, M. Guix, W. Gao, S. Sattayasamitsathit, J.C. Claussen, A. Merkoci, J. Wang

    Nano Letters 12 (1), 396-401, 2011

  13. Effects of Carbon Nanotube-Tethered Nanosphere Density on Amperometric Biosensing: Simulation and Experiment

    J.C. Claussen, J.B. Hengenius, M.M. Wickner, T.S. Fisher, D.M. Umulis, D.M. Porterfield

    The Journal of Physical Chemistry C. 115 (43), 20896–20904, 2011

  14. A comparative study of enzyme immobilization strategies for multi-walled carbon nanotube glucose biosensors

    J. Shi, J.C. Claussen, E.S. McLamore, A. ul Haque, D. Jaroch, A.R. Diggs, P. Calvo-Marzal, J. L. Rickus, D.M. Porterfield

    Nanotechnology 22 (35), 355502, 2011

  15. Electrochemical glutamate biosensing with nanocube and nanosphere augmented single-walled carbon nanotube networks: a comparative study

    J.C. Claussen, M.S. Artiles, E.S. McLamore, S. Mohanty, J. Shi, J.L. Rickus, T.S. Fisher, D.M. Porterfield

    Journal of Materials Chemistry 21 (30), 11224-11231, 2011

  16. Microbiosensors based on DNA modified single-walled carbon nanotube and Pt black nanocomposites

    J. Shi, T.G. Cha, J.C. Claussen, A.R. Diggs, J.H. Choi, D.M. Porterfield

    Analyst 136 (23), 4916-4924, 2011

  17. Transforming the fabrication and biofunctionalization of gold nanoelectrode arrays into versatile electrochemical glucose biosensors

    J.C. Claussen, M. Wickner, T.S. Fisher, D.M. Porterfield

    ACS Applied Materials & Interfaces 3 (5), 1765–1770, 2011

  18. A self-referencing platinum nanoparticle decorated enzyme-based microbiosensor for real-time measurement of physiological glucose transport

    E.S. McLamore, J. Shi, D. Jaroch, J.C. Claussen, A. Uchida, Y. Jiang, W. Zhang, M.K. Banks, K.K. Buhman, D. Teegarden, J.L. Rickus, D.M. Porterfield

    Biosensors and Bioelectronics 26 (5), 2237-2245, 2011

  19. Oscillatory glucose flux in INS1 pancreatic Beta cells: a self-referencing microbiosensor study

    J. Shi, E.S. McLamore, D. Jaroch, J.C. Claussen, J.L. Rickus, D.M. Porterfield

    Analytical Biochemistry 411 (2), 185–193, 2010

  20. Electrochemical glucose biosensor of platinum nanospheres connected by carbon nanotubes

    J.C. Claussen, S.S. Kim, A. ul Haque, M.S. Artiles, D.M. Porterfield, T.S. Fisher

    Journal of Diabetes Science and Technology 4 (2), 312, 2010

  21. A self-referencing glutamate biosensor for measuring real-time neuronal glutamate flux

    E.S. McLamore, S. Mohanty, J. Shi, J. Claussen, J.L. Rickus, S. Jedlicka, D.M. Porterfield

    Journal of Neuroscience Methods 189 (1), 14-22, 2010

  22. Electrochemical biosensor of nanocube-augmented carbon nanotube networks

    J.C. Claussen, A.D. Franklin, A. ul Haque, D.M. Porterfield, T.S. Fisher

    ACS Nano 3 (1), 37-44, 2009

  23. Independently addressable fields of porous anodic alumina embedded in SiO2 on Si

    A.D. Franklin, D.B. Janes, J.C. Claussen, T.S. Fisher, T.D. Sands

    Applied Physics Letters 92 (1), 013122-013122-3, 2008

    24. Book Chapters

  24. "Hybrid metallic nanoparticles: enhanced bioanalysis and biosensing via carbon nanotubes, graphene, and organic conjugation"

    M. Daniele, S. Campuzano, F. Kirilay, E.S. McLamore, Allison Cargill, Shaowei Ding, J.C. Claussen

    Nanobiosensors and Nanobioanalyses. Springer (In Press)

  25. "FRET-based cellular sensing with genetically encoded fluorescent indicators"

    J.C. Claussen, I.L. Medintz

    FRET – Förster Resonance Energy Transfer. From Theory to Applications. Wiley-VCH, (2013), ISBN: 9783527656028

  26. "Nano-sized biosensors"

    J.C. Claussen, J. Shi, C.S. Rout, M.S. Artiles, M.M. Wickner, M.S. Stensberg, D.M. Porterfield, T.S. Fisher

    Biosensors for Medical Applications. Woodhead Publishing, (2012), ISBN 1 84569 935

  27. Electrochemical Biosensors of Carbon Nanotubes

    J.C. Claussen, J. Shi, A.R. Diggs, D.M. Porterfield, T.S. Fisher

    Nanomaterials for the Life Sciences, Ch. 8 (pp. 187-217) Wiley-VCH, (2011), ISBN 978-3-527-32169-8

    28. Conference Proceedings

  28. "Enhancing molecular logic through modulation of temporal and spatial constraints with quantum dot-based systems that use fluorescent (förster) resonance energy transfer"

    J.C. Claussen, W. R. Algar, N. Hildebrandt, K. Susumu, M. G. Ancona, I.L. Medintz

    SPIE Nanoscience & Engineering Meeting, San Diego, CA. (2013).

    J.C. Claussen, A. ul Haque, T.S. Fisher, M.D. Porterfield

    Materials Research Society Conference, Boston, MA (2009).

    30. Research Reports

    Sensing & Measurements, SPIE Newsroom – Nanotechnology (2013), DOI: 10.1117/2.1201308.005030

  31. “Using Nanotechnology to Improve Lab on a Chip Devices”

    J.C. Claussen, I.L. Medintz

    J. Biochip Tissue Chip., (2012), DOI: 10.4172/2153-0777.1000e117

Facilities

where the magic happens

Student and Graduate Student Office Space located at Black Engineering Building.

Laboratory space with chemical/biological hoods located at Gilman Hall.

Cleanroom and nano-manufacturing/characterization located at the Applied Sciences Complex.

Drop on by some time!
